oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Discussion - Lynn Anderson - 2017-09-30
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A Rose Is a Rose: Celebration the life of Lynn Anderson panel discussion from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on September 30, 2017. Hosted by Michael McCall. Participants include Lynn's father Casey Anderson, Steve Gibson, Manuel Cuevas, Buddy Skipper and Lynn's daughther Lisa Sutton. Includes audio from video and recorded audio excerpts. In support of the exhibition Lynn Anderson: Keep Me in Mind.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Michael McCall; Casey Anderson; Steve Gibson; Manuel Cuevas; Buddy Skipper; Lisa Sutton;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in Music / (03:17) Opening comments by Michael McCall and introduction of participants / (10:19) Audio from video of Lynn Anderson singing (I Never Promised You A) Rose Garden / (12:13) Casey talks about hearing Rose Garden for the first time / (14:12) Manuel talks about Lynn's beauty and the imagery used in Lynn's outfits / (16:45) Steve talks about joining Lynn's band and the impact of Rose Garden / (19:22) Buddy talks about Lynn and her live show and the reaction to the song Rose Garden / (20:19) Buddy tells story about Lynn recording Rose Garden / (21:02) Casey talks about his current CD and tells story about the family travelling to California / (23:22) Casey talks about Liz Anderson's songwriting career and a phone call from Lawrence Welk regarding Lynn / (26:36) Casey talks about Lynn working with Lawrence Welk / (27:22) Play clip of Lynn performing Ride, Ride, Ride on the Porter Wagoner TV show / (29:10) Lisa talks about how her parents met /

(30:26) Lisa talks about her father Glenn Sutton and her parents working and domestic relationship / (33:23) Lisa talks about her feelings about Rose Garden / (34:23) Casey talks about Glenn Sutton / (35:05) Lisa talks about her father / (35:33) Steve talks about Glenn Sutton / (38:35) Lisa talks about her Mom's upbringing and fashion sense / (39:05) Manuel talks about Lynn's fashion sense / (41:25) Lisa talks about the addition of the Countrypolitian sound to Lynn's music / (41:58) Buddy talks about Glenn Sutton and working on Lynn's recordings / (43:01) Lynn talks about Buddy's string arrangements and Lynn appearing on television shows / (43:46) Buddy talks about traveling with string arrangements / (44:33) Steve talks about the experience that appearing on the Lawrence Welk television show gave Lynn for future TV appearances / (46:24) Casey talks about the influence of Steve Gibson and Buddy Skipper on Lynn's career /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Anderson, Lynn; Anderson, Casey; Gibson, Steve; Cuevas, Manuel; Skipper, Buddy; Sutton, Lisa; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
